message.content:
cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE. 

The paper deals with the problem of robot construction, which involves planning and coordination of multiple autonomous robots to build stable structures. This problem is at the intersection of several sub-fields of computer science, including artificial intelligence (AI), robotics (RO), logic (LO), programming languages (PL), and software engineering (SE). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI and cs.RO, which are directly related to the problem of robot construction. The paper also proposes a formal planning framework based on Answer Set Programming, which falls under the category of logic (cs.LO) and programming languages (cs.PL). Finally, the paper discusses the applicability of the proposed method using a bimanual Baxter robot, which involves software engineering aspects such as implementation and testing, hence the sub-category cs.SE is also relevant.
